comment.author: 7517351@N05
comment._content: Your bang on the money, its Fredrick street north, right outside the entrance of the garden of remembrance today. One of the buildings has a distinct archway on the entrance and the wall surface is different to all the others in the row. This building is still the same today. :) maps.google.ie/maps?q=frederick+street+dublin&hl=en&a...

comment.author: 7517351@N05
comment._content:
PS. I'm a big fan of the collection. Is this collection displayed anywhere I can view them?  and can copies be obtained?
I've come across a few buildings that have some significance with my family and it would be nice to have a copy. 

Thanks. :)

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/richiesphotos] Excellent! Thanks for that - have amended location on the map...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/richiesphotos] We have regular exhibitions in the National Photographic Archive in Temple Bar. Next one (opening September) is Small Lives - photos from our collections that have children as their focus. Otherwise search our catalogue with Show Digitised Items Only box clicked. There're currently 38,599 photos to view, with more being added: catalogue.nli.ie/ Hi-Res tiffs of any photo you like can be obtained from our Reprographics Dept. at a cost of €19 per image: www.nli.ie/en/copying-services.aspx Have at them! :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 7517351@N05
comment._content: Thank you, I wasn't aware of that website, I'll get stuck in. :)
